intro: Selaginella rupestris var. sibirica, commonly known as the Siberian spikemoss, is a species of spikemoss belonging to the family Selaginellaceae. It is a small, evergreen plant that typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. The plant features a creeping stem with whorled leaves that are needle-like in appearance. It is characterized by its ability to survive in harsh conditions, making it a hardy and resilient species. This variety is native to regions of Siberia and is often found in mountainous areas where it thrives in well-drained soil.
